translations.translation: He thought that he was never going to return.
thinking he would never revert (to Us).
and had thought that they would never be brought back to life again.
He assumed that he does not have to return.
Verily, he thought that he would never return!
Surely he thought that he would never return.
he surely thought he would never revert.
He verily deemed that he would never return (unto Allah).
for he never thought that he would have to return [to God].
Verily he imagined that he would not be back.
and he thought that he would never return.
Truly, did he think that he would not have to return (to Us)!
Verily, he thought that he would never come back (to Us)!
and surely thought he would never return (to his Lord).
He thought he would never return.
Indeed, he had thought he would never return [to Allah].
[84:14] indeed he thought that (an: softened in place of the hardened form, with its subject omitted, that is to say, annahu) he would never return, to his Lord.
(He verily deemed that he would never return (unto Allah)) in the Hereafter.

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text: وقوله تعالى: { إِنَّهُ ظَنَّ أَن لَّن يَحُورَ } معناه يَرجِعُ

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: وإنما حمله عليه { إِنَّهُ ظَنَّ } بل تيقن جهلاً وعناداً { أَن لَّن يَحُورَ } [الانشقاق: 14] أي: لن ينقلب ويرجع إلى الله، ولن يقوم بين يديه سبحانه للحساب والجزاء؛ لذلك أجترأ من المعاصي

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text:
وقيل: كان لنفسه متابعاً، وفي هواه راتعاً، { إِنه ظنّ أن لن يَحُورَ } لن يرجع إلى ربه، تكذيباً بالبعث
 قال ابن عباس: ما عرفتُ تفسيره حتى سمعت أعرابية تقول لبنتها: حُوري
 أي: ارجعي
